qas.question: What was one subject that Avicenna further developed?
Who is another philosopher during this Islamic Golden Age?
What is the name of one library that Avicenna had access to?
Who was the famous astronomer that Avicenna met before he left Khwarezm?
What text was proof that Avicenna debated philosophy with some of the greatest scholars of the time?
Where did the study of all religious texts thrive?
What studies were suppresed by Avicenna's opponents?
who provided methodology and knowledge in theology?
Who was the famous astronomer that Avicenna met after leaving Khwarezm?
What was one subject that Avicenna never developed?
Who is another philosopher during this Islamic Silver Age?
What is the name of one library that Avicenna didn't have access to?
Who was the famous astrologer that Avicenna met before he left Khwarezm?
What text was proof that Avicenna debated philosophy with some of the unknown scholars of the time?

context: The study of the Quran and the Hadith thrived <b5_0>in such a scholarly atmosphere<b5_0/>. <b6_0>Philosophy, Fiqh and <a0_0><b10_0>theology<b10_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/> (kalaam) were further developed, most noticeably by Avicenna and his opponents. <b7_0>Al-Razi and <a1_0><b11_0>Al-Farabi<b11_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/> had provided methodology and knowledge in medicine and philosophy. Avicenna had access to the great libraries of Balkh, Khwarezm, Gorgan, Rey, Isfahan and <a2_0><b8_0><b12_0>Hamadan<b12_0/><b8_0/><a2_0/>. Various texts (such as <a4_0><b14_0>the 'Ahd with Bahmanyar<b14_0/><a4_0/>) show that he debated philosophical points with the greatest scholars of the time. Aruzi Samarqandi describes how before Avicenna left Khwarezm he had met <a3_0><b9_0><b13_0>Al-Biruni<b13_0/><b9_0/><a3_0/> (a famous scientist and astronomer), Abu Nasr Iraqi (a renowned mathematician), Abu Sahl Masihi (a respected philosopher) and Abu al-Khayr Khammar (a great physician).
